reviews.text:
We came here to visit a friend who lives in Prague with his wife and kids. He's a trendy fellow and a food snob, as he should be. He is Czech.

In any case, the menu has an eclectic mix of different types of international finger foods and delicious daily soup specials.

It's not particularly fancy, but the interior design is casual, the wait staff is friendly enough and the wine list includes glass pricing, so who am I to complain?

Quite a nice place with friendly atmosphere where you can feel the latino touch.... the space is pleasant, nice toilets and quite ok food but the way they serve it and also the service could be definitely improved. It's good place for a chill with friends but not to come for a romantic dinner

You must visit the bathroom. Well the one wheelchair accessible where do they also have a changing place foe babies. I am serious, i was impressed. They even had baby wipes (eco version) :) we visited with our 6month old so definitely appreciate that..

Anyway, I am not sure why this is called LatinAmerican. Aaah maybe because they have nachos and quessadilla. Most of the food is burger, sandwiches and bbq. 

The prices are reasonable i guess for the burger considering the place. The burger and fries were good but not special. They do not offer fries included with burger (or anything else) and they do not bring any salsa or sauce.

The service - well 3stars.

Everything was wonderful at the BlackDog Cantina. Josef provided excellent and friendly service. We started with the local garlic soup, was very flavorful and savory. Next the Caesar salad, dressing was excellent. For the main course, the 60 day wet aged ribeye. It was cooked to perfection with roasted garlic. We loved everything so much, we came back a second time.

Busy pub with great food, good service. I had the chili made with black beans and jalapenos and wow it was good. I had a beer along with that of course. I wanted to go back and try more but I ran out of time. It would probably be prudent to make a reservation. They're also dog-friendly.

The atomic burger here is bomb(haha)!! It was super moist and super spicy which I love. Also the barbecue is a cool sweet flavor which is fun. Everyone was super nice. I would recommend to anyone looking for a big juicy burger

It was hard for me to tell if this was a burger place or a Latin American place judging from online descriptions. It is a burger restaurant. It was really crowded when we arrived, but we were able to find a table. My husband said his burger was good but nothing special. I would say the same about my salad and and Mac and cheese. We chose this place based on its vicinity to our hotel, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
Even after 20min waiter havent show up and ask what i would like to have. There werent even busy.
Mediocre food. Nice concept and interesting menu, but poor execution. Not to mention pricey.

Food was good. We just wanted something quick and easy with a beer. Burgers were cooked perfect, decent amount to choose from. Beer selection was a bit limited. Friendly staff. Be aware, there is an up charge for everything. I mean everything. Ketchup was additional, mayo additional...maybe thats just how if is here? Was our first meal in Prague. Would go again though.
